page.title: 01SUMMARY
page.content: This area, 2\km SW of the city centre, has changed greatly from being industrial in the C19 to residential, containing the districts of{Moseley and{Bournbrook}where houses date back to late Victorian and early Edwardian.However industry has remained in{Selly Oak}&{Balsall Heath The area has recreation facilities as well as major sporting venues e.g {Edgbaston Cricket Ground}which is used for both county and international matches.Other facilities include the {Reddings Rugby Ground}.The area contains many interesting places, e.g The{Arts Centre}at{Cannon Hill Park, the{BBC Centre}at{Pebble Mill}and {Birmingham University}whose major feature is the Clock Tower,"Big Joe". The{Queen Elizabeth}and{Selly Oak {Hospitals}are Birmingham's major teaching hospitals.
